pull.title: qt: Ensure that ModalOverlay is resized properly
pull.body:
In certain circumstances the `ModalOverlay` widget is not sized properly:
- #17269
- #17967 
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/17968#pullrequestreview-350753107

On master (f018d0c9cd7f408dac016b6bfc873670de713d27) this bug looks like this:
![DeepinScreenshot_bitcoin-qt_20200120193402](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/32963518/72748165-298b2a80-3bbf-11ea-810d-2966f08e496a.png)

With this PR the wallet frame looks ok:
![DeepinScreenshot_bitcoin-qt_20200120195241](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/32963518/72748388-c64dc800-3bbf-11ea-8875-1ba1899b3513.png)

Fix #17269
Fix #17967

events.body: Unrelated but while we are here you can notice that if the window height is increased while the modal is hiding then it will stay a little visible like: because the animation end value doesn't track the new height. Honestly why not drop the animation and eventually make it a modal dialog instead of being embedded?
@hebasto here and master. You can check more easily by increasing the animation duration.

Reworked and rebased.

@promag 
> Unrelated but while we are here you can notice that if the window height is increased while the modal is hiding then it will stay a little visible like:
> ...
> because the animation end value doesn't track the new height.

Fixed.

issue.title: Qt: If you reindex a black bar shows up on the bottom of the window when the sync overlay is hidden
issue.body:
I was testing from commit be50469217bd775c4305938634c32e5932f47841 and noticed that the "out of sync" overlay went away correctly after mining blocks, but then after restarting with --reindex this black bar shows up after the overlay is hidden. I've only tested this in regtest mode. I'm not sure that the issue is related to the overlay but it seems to show up right when the overlay is hidden. 

![Screenshot_20191026_171200](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8107318/67627655-16153100-f815-11e9-967a-d5ea0a254965.png)


On another system:


Before reindex
![Screenshot_20191026_174635](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8107318/67627854-3515c200-f819-11e9-87b2-c6f8172480fd.png)


After reindex 
![Screenshot_20191026_174657](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8107318/67627855-38a94900-f819-11e9-87c1-c5296c1a2636.png)

qt: Track QEvent::Resize during animation

events.body:
Updated 14f68ecdc22e96011e53b6aea5672c853e2c648b -> 4fc1df41d570ab631a8b47e4427a0b84305e37d1 ([pr17968.02](https://github.com/hebasto/bitcoin/commits/pr17968.02) -> [pr17968.03](https://github.com/hebasto/bitcoin/commits/pr17968.03), [diff](https://github.com/hebasto/bitcoin/compare/pr17968.02..pr17968.03)):

- addressed @promag's comments
- added comment for clarity

comments.body: nit, m_animation, m_slide_animation or something like that. Also, could drop `{}`?
nit, `== QPropertyAnimation::Running`? Also add `> 0` or maybe a comment giving some context.

According to the [`enum QAbstractAnimation::State`](https://doc.qt.io/qt-5/qabstractanimation.html#State-enum) docs, `state != QAbstractAnimation::Stopped` does not imply `state == QAbstractAnimation::Running` :)

Going to add `>0`.
We don't pause right? Oh well, just drop it and always update when > 0
